title: Adoption visa
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Adoption visa (subclass 102), a permanent visa allowing a child adopted outside Australia to live in Australia with their adoptive parent. It outlines eligibility criteria, costs, processing times, obligations, and key rules for travel, application, and intercountry adoption.

structured_data.description: This visa lets children adopted outside Australia live in Australia with their adoptive parent.

key_updates.details: Applicants for Child visa subclasses 101, 102, 802, 445, 117 and 837 can import their paper application into ImmiAccount.

key_updates.note: Some applications lodged outside Australia before 1 April 2020 cannot be imported into ImmiAccount.

stay_and_travel_rights.stay: Indefinitely in Australia as a permanent resident
stay_and_travel_rights.travel_facility: 5 years from date of visa grant
after_travel_facility_expires: Apply for a Resident Return Visa (RRV) to re-enter Australia
Consider Australian citizenship; Australian citizens do not require a visa to enter and must use an Australian passport

benefits: Sponsor relatives to come to Australia
Attend free English classes through the Adult Migrant English Program (if eligible)

eligibility.age_requirements: Child must be under 18 at adoption, when applying, and when decision is made
eligibility.location_requirements: Child must be outside Australia when applying and when decision is made
adoption_requirements: Child must have been adopted or be in the process of being adopted by their sponsor parent
eligibility.covid_concessions: Child may be eligible for COVID-19 visa concessions

accepted_adoption_types: Intercountry adoption involving an Australian state or territory central authority
Intercountry adoption between two Hague Convention countries
Expatriate adoption with no involvement of Australian state or territory central authority
sponsor_requirements: Sponsor must be an Australian citizen, eligible New Zealand citizen, or Australian permanent visa holder
Sponsor must have resided outside Australia for more than 12 months before lodging the application

government_role: Australian government does not issue letters of no objection
Their role is to assess and decide visa applications
country_restrictions: Adoption visa applications cannot be accepted for children adopted in Pakistan

including_other_children.siblings: Separate applications must be lodged for each sibling
dependent_children: Child’s dependent children may be included when applying or added before a decision
Dependent children must meet health requirements
Non-migrating family members may also need to meet health requirements

tools: Visa Pricing Estimator (does not include additional costs)

application_rules.apply_from: Child must be outside Australia at time of application

processing_times.note: Use the visa processing time guide tool for recent processing times
factors_that_delay_processing: Incomplete payment or payment of incorrect visa charge

obligations.first_entry_requirement: Child must enter Australia before the date specified in the grant letter (generally within 12 months of visa grant)
legal_requirements: Must comply with all visa conditions

visa_label.linking_method: Visa is digitally linked to child’s passport

other_information.help_with_visa: Applicants should read information about who can assist with visa applications before paying anyone
